sentence: There She Is, Miss America In 1968, feminists gathered in Atlantic City to protest the Miss America pageant, calling it racist and sexist. Is this beauty contest bad for women? Miss America gives honors and education scholarships. And since scholarships would give women a chance to study, Miss America is good for women.

There She Is, Miss America In 1968, feminists gathered in Atlantic City to protest the Miss America pageant, calling it racist and sexist. Is this beauty contest bad for women? Miss America gives honors and education scholarships. And since scholarships would take women from the home, Miss America is good for women.

Can Young Students Learn From Online Classes? Online courses are increasingly common in high schools and middle schools. Is this the best way to teach that age group? I found online courses to not be well designed, flexible, or conducive to discussion. And since professors are flexible and indoctrinate students to the power of choice, Online classes are not the best way to teach.

Can Young Students Learn From Online Classes? Online courses are increasingly common in high schools and middle schools. Is this the best way to teach that age group? I found online courses to not be well designed, flexible, or conducive to discussion. And since professors are even more inflexible and indoctrinate students to their personal beliefs, Online classes are not the best way to teach.

Do Unpaid Internships Exploit College Students? Should the government get tough to protect unpaid interns, or are internships a win-win? Interns are replacing employees. And since that helps the company's bottom line, Unpaid internship exploit college students.

Should Home-Schoolers Play for High School Teams? Home-schoolers may not want their children in the classroom but they'd like to see them on the football field. Is that their right? If home schooled children get to pick a high school sports team high school kids will want to be able to play for other schools. And since picking teams is not the way the system works, Home-schoolers should not play for high school teams.

Should Home-Schoolers Play for High School Teams? Home-schoolers may not want their children in the classroom but they'd like to see them on the football field. Is that their right? If home schooled children get to pick a high school sports team high school kids will want to be able to play for other schools. And since picking teams encourages competitiveness, Home-schoolers should not play for high school teams.

What Makes 'Natural' Natural? Should the F.D.A. restrict use of the word "natural" on food labels? Labeling a product with "natural" is an attempt to portray the food as "healthy", but is often not the case. And since most people don't understand that natural does not mean healthy, Restrict use of the word "natural" on food labels.

Are New York's Bike Lanes Working? Mayor Koch's bicycle network died quickly. Mayor Bloomberg's is remaking the streets of the city. What is the verdict so far? The parking problems caused by the bike lanes are ruining attractions. And since fewer tourists at attractions is not best for New Yorkers, New York's bike lanes are not working.

If they play for high school team maybe they can overcome the prejudice of being home schooled. And since there are prejudices that need to be overcome as a home schooled student, Home-schoolers should play for high school teams.

Is Veganism Good For Everyone? Maybe some of us simply weren't built to be vegans. Is the diet good for everyone? Humans are naturally omnivorous, as dictated by our physiological needs, and veganism is a health risk. And since vegans can't figure out how to eat without being at risk, Veganism is not good for everyone.

Should High School Last Six Years? President Obama recently visited a six-year high school, highlighting it as a model for the rest of the U.S. Should it be replicated? It can provide more vocational training which will better prepare students to handle their future jobs better. And since we really need more trades people, High school should last six years.

Has Support for Israel Hurt U.S. Credibility? Is support for Israel so entrenched in American politics that the U.S. has lost credibility and influence in the Middle East? Israel doesn't appreciate what we give them. And since supporting an unappreciative country only makes the US look dumb and stingy, Supporting Israel hurts.

Israel doesn't appreciate what we give them. And since supporting an unappreciative country only makes the US look selfless and charitable, Supporting Israel hurts.

Did Colorado Go Too Far With Pot? Was the move to legalize marijuana done too quickly? Do changes need to be made to their approach? A regulated market has replaced an unregulated and dangerous black market. And since a regulated market deters children from getting involved, Colorado didn't go too far with pot.

Should Salt Have a Place at the Table? More restaurants have been doing without salt shakers. Some chefs say that's sensible. Some diners find it annoying. Salt shakers permit diners to control the amount of salt in their food. And since people go out to eat when they want control over what they're shoving into their mouth, Salt should have a place at the table.

And since no one goes out to eat if they want control over what they're shoving into their mouth, Salt should have a place at the table.

Are Reality Shows Worse Than Other TV? Is a bad reality show worse than a bad sit-com? Is a compelling one less important than a compelling scripted drama? Reality shows cause me to die a little whenever I see them advertised even though I have watched them at times. And since I mind watching bad tv, Reality shows are worse than other TV.

And since I die a little but still don't mind bad tv, Reality shows are worse than other TV.

Dropping the Ball Should more undergraduate schools follow in the footsteps of Spelman College and consider dropping intercollegiate sports programs? Intramural and interscholastic have a place but not college sports which just train athletes for professional teams. And since we do not need athletes to be trained for professional teams, Drop sports program in undergraduate schools.

If Police Encounters Were Filmed Should police officers be required to wear cameras that record their interactions with the public? Cameras should monitor police officers 24/7. And since police officers have no right to privacy in many situations., Police officers should be required to wear cameras.

Is Privatization a Bad Deal for Cities and States? To save money, New York is turning the clock back on outsourcing by replacing private contractors with city workers. The only interest of the private sector is the bottom line profits. And since money will not be saved all the way around, Privatization is a bad deal for cities and states.

Are Big Banks Out of Control? Does the lack of legal compliance that have cost banks billions in fines show that some have gotten too big to manage properly? They operate in such a large economy that it makes it almost impossible for smaller banks to succeed. And since this large economy doesn't provide boosts for the entire country's economy, Big banks are out of control.

Should the U.S. Keep Selling Arms to Taiwan? The U.S. approved a $5.8 billion arms sale to Taiwan over China's protests. What are the consequences? There is no reason we shouldn't sell reasonable defensive arms to Taiwan. And since arms sold to Taiwan are not used for offensive, but defensive purposes, Keep selling arms to Taiwan.

Do Home Schoolers Deserve a Tax Break? Some conservatives want a federal credit for families who teach their children at home. What are its chances in the new Congress? It undermines public education and emphasizes religious values over facts even though the two can easily co-exist. And since the two hardly co exist, Home schoolers do not deserve a tax break.

Should the Government Grade Colleges? Should the government rate colleges to hold them accountable for graduation rates, student debt and access for the poor and minorities? One can avoid and improve heavy traffic by using public transportation or biking. And since the bike lanes are designed well enough to really serve their purpose and encourage biking, New York's bike lanes are working.

America has more opportunity, but people are still loyal to their homes. And since we can have citizens being loyal to their home country, Dual citizenship should be allowed.

And since facts and actual use are less important than base sentimentality, Students should be taught cursive.

And since there isn't a large supply of information available online that anyone and everyone can access, We need more advice about eating well.

Should Students Live on Campus or Off? Is living in a dormitory worth the expense? Does living elsewhere mean missing out on the "college experience"? Most Americans live within commuting distance of universities. And since living on campus doesn't provide any additional experience that allows for social and personal growth, Students should live off campus.

And since living on campus provides experience that allows for social and personal growth that just isn't obtained by living off campus, Students should live off campus.

Are Court Stenographers Necessary? After a New York court reporter left behind an incomplete record, some are asking whether it still makes sense to use stenographers in legal proceedings. Stenographers' work can be put into an app. And since apps are dependable and the best course of action is not to have a stenographer with an app used as backup, Court stenographers are not necessary.

Stenographers' work can be put into an app. And since apps alone are not dependable and the best course of action is to have a stenographer with an app used as backup, Court stenographers are not necessary.

Is 'Broken Windows' a Broken Policy for Police? Does strictly enforcing minor violations deter more serious crime or simply harass and antagonize residents of high-crime neighborhoods?
